revised_title: Spin-Lattice Relaxation in Rare-Earth Salts: Phenomenological Approach and Experimental Verification
tldr: This article presents a phenomenological approach to spin-lattice relaxation in rare-earth salts, using the crystalline field theory of Stevens. The authors evaluate the spin-lattice interaction in terms of a few constants and investigate one- and two-phonon processes. They compute relaxation times for non-Kramers and Kramers salts and apply the general theory to holmium and dysprosium ethyl sulfate. The study shows that a resonance process, analogous to the resonance radiation effect in gases, dominates the relaxation process in rare-earth salts, leading to a relaxation time proportional to the inverse of the temperature.
